required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Biology and Experience of Eating in Women With Obesity
clinical_study.official_title: Biology and Experience of Eating in Women With Obesity

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to understand how the opioid system is involved in eating behavior.

detailed_description.textblock: Obesity is associated with greater risk for cardiovascular disease (CVD), stroke, diabetes, and mortality, and is a heterogeneous condition with various causes and thus a diversity of intervention targets. Compulsive overeating afflicts 30% of people seeking obesity treatment and increases risk for CVD factors. This trial involves two participant visits to test whether opioid blockade (Day 1 or 2, depending on randomization), compared to placebo (Day 1 or 2, depending on randomization), will elicit common symptoms of opioid withdrawal, including nausea. Participants will receive each condition on separate days.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Reported Nausea at 10 Minutes Post Treatment
primary_outcome.description: Dichotomized response on the "I feel nauseous" question of the Subjective Opiate Withdrawal Scale, at 10 minutes after the listed intervention (among participants who completed both intervention visits). Response 0 = absence of nausea, 1 = presence of nausea.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Reported Nausea at 30 Minutes Post Treatment
primary_outcome.description: Dichotomized response on the "I feel nauseous" question of the Subjective Opiate Withdrawal Scale, at 30 minutes after the listed intervention (among participants who completed both intervention visits). Response 0 = absence of nausea, 1 = presence of nausea.

secondary_outcome.description: Summed score of Subjective Opiate Withdrawal Scale (SOWS). Scale consists of 16 items answered on a 5 point numeric rating scale. Score range is 0 (lesser withdrawal symptoms) to 64 (greater withdrawal symptoms). Scores were assessed at 10 minutes after Naloxone, and at a separate visit, 10 minutes after Placebo, among participants who completed both study visits.

Mean score on subset of 5 items (which used a 5 point numeric rating response scale) from the Subjective Opiate Withdrawal Scale (SOWS). This summed score can range from 0 (corresponding to lesser withdrawal symptoms) to 20 (corresponding to greater withdrawal symptoms).

other_outcome.description: Reward-Driven Eating Scale (RED) total score ranges from 0 (lower reward-driven eating) to 52 (higher reward-driven eating).

other_outcome.time_frame: Impulsivity was assessed before the study visit 1 intervention.
other_outcome.description: Impulsivity, measured by the Delayed Discounting cognitive task, based on a series of 30 computer-administered trials or questions. Indifference points (a measure of how much a person values a delayed reward) are determined for time delays of: 1 day, 7 days, 30 days, 180 days, and 365 days, and these are used to calculate an Area Under the Curve which ranges from 0 to 1 (lower numbers indicate higher impulsivity) as a metric of probability.

arm_group.description: 4 mg / 0.1 ml Naloxone at visit 1, followed by 0.1 ml saline (Placebo) at visit 2 (with a washout period in between the two visits)
0.1 ml saline (Placebo) at visit 1, followed by 4 mg / 0.1 ml Naloxone at visit 2 (with a washout period in between the two visits)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Obese, as defined by BMI greater than or equal to 30
- Self-reported binge eating as defined in the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders (DSM-5), in the last 4 weeks
- If sexually active with men, must agree to use birth control until the final study visit is complete (e.g., barrier methods, oral contraceptive)
- Subject must be able to complete written informed consent procedures and be able to comply with the requirements of the study.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant or breastfeeding
- Severe hypotension (< 90/60 mmHg)
- Recent or current use of vasoconstrictor or vasodilator medication
- Current or history of diabetes
- Allergies to any ingredients in naloxone hydrochloride
- History of or current alcoholism or drug dependence
- Bulimia Nervosa as defined in DSM 5
- Current or past use of opiate-containing medications in the last 30 days
- Plan to use opiate-containing medications during study participation period
- Medical conditions that are contraindicated with intranasal procedures: Nasal septal abnormalities, nasal trauma, epistaxis, excessive nasal mucus, and intranasal damage caused by the use of substances (e.g., cocaine)
- Presence of a condition or abnormality that in the opinion of the Investigator would compromise the safety of the subject or the quality of the data

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

group.title: Experimental: Naloxone, Then Placebo
group.description: At the first intervention visit, participants were administered Naloxone, 4 mg / 0.1 ml, intranasally, after eating. After the washout period, at the second intervention visit, participants were administered the Placebo (saline), 0.1 ml, intranasally, after eating.

group.title: Experimental: Placebo, Then Naloxone
group.description: At the first intervention visit, participants were administered the Placebo (saline), 0.1 ml, intranasally, after eating. After the washout period, at the second intervention visit, participants were administered Naloxone, 4 mg / 0.1 ml, intranasally, after eating.

group.title: Naloxone, Then Placebo
group.description: At visit 1, participants were administered Naloxone, 4 mg/ 0.1 ml, intranasally, after eating. After the washout period between visits, at visit 2, participants were administered the Placebo (saline), 0.1 ml, intranasally, after eating.

group.title: Placebo, Then Naloxone
group.description: At visit 1, participants were administered the Placebo (saline), 0.1 ml, intranasally, after eating. After the washout period between visits, at visit 2, participants were administered Naloxone, 4 mg/ 0.1 ml, intranasally, after eating.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Weight, kg
measure.description: Participants were weighted two times at baseline and the average of two measures was used (weight in kilograms).

measure.title: Body Mass Index (BMI)
measure.description: Body mass index (BMI) was calculated from the mean of duplicate weight measurements, and the height measurement, at baseline. BMI units are kilograms per meter squared (kg/m^2)

measure.title: Impulsivity
measure.description: Impulsivity, measured by the Delayed Discounting cognitive task, based on a series of 30 computer-administered trials or questions. Indifference points (a measure of how much a person values a delayed reward) are determined for time delays of: 1 day, 7 days, 30 days, 180 days, and 365 days, and these are used to calculate an Area Under the Curve which ranges from 0 to 1 (lower numbers indicate higher impulsivity) as a metric of probability.

measure.title: Reward-driven Eating (RED) scale
measure.description: Total score ranges from 0 (lower reward-driven eating) to 52 (higher reward-driven eating).

outcome.title: Number of Participants Who Reported Nausea at 10 Minutes Post Treatment
outcome.description: Dichotomized response on the "I feel nauseous" question of the Subjective Opiate Withdrawal Scale, at 10 minutes after the listed intervention (among participants who completed both intervention visits). Response 0 = absence of nausea, 1 = presence of nausea.
outcome.population: All participants who received Naloxone, then Placebo, or Placebo, then Naloxone, by participating in both study intervention visits.

outcome.title: Cortisol
outcome.population: Participants 25 minutes after Naloxone or Placebo administration, among those who completed both intervention visits

group.title: Naloxone
group.description: Measurement of Cortisol here reported 25 min post Naloxone, among all participants who received Naloxone (4mg / 0.1 ml), then after a washout period, received Placebo (saline, 0.1 ml), or Placebo, then after a washout period, received Naloxone, by participating in both study intervention visits.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Measurement of Cortisol here reported 25 min post Placebo, among all participants who received Naloxone (4mg / 0.1 ml), then after a washout period, received Placebo (saline, 0.1 ml), or Placebo, then after a washout period, received Naloxone, by participating in both study intervention visits.

measure.title: Cortisol
measure.population: Participants 25 minutes after Naloxone or Placebo administration, among those who completed both intervention visits

outcome.title: Cortisol
outcome.population: Participants 55 minutes after Naloxone or Placebo administration, among those who completed both intervention visits

group.title: Naloxone
group.description: Measurement of Cortisol here reported 55 min post Naloxone, among all participants who received Naloxone (4mg / 0.1 ml), then after a washout period, received Placebo (saline, 0.1 ml), or Placebo, then after a washout period, received Naloxone, by participating in both study intervention visits.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Measurement of Cortisol here reported 55 min post Placebo, among all participants who received Naloxone (4mg / 0.1 ml), then after a washout period, received Placebo (saline, 0.1 ml), or Placebo, then after a washout period, received Naloxone, by participating in both study intervention visits.

measure.title: Cortisol
measure.population: Participants 55 minutes after Naloxone or Placebo administration, among those who completed both intervention visits

analysis.groups_desc: We compared cortisol values at 55 minutes, within person, across conditions. We Winsorized one participant's values for the placebo visit where values were between 2-4x above the 99th percentile value in the data and then log-transformed the data.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: The null hypothesis is that there would be no difference across the Naloxone and placebo conditions. The alternative hypothesis is that the cortisol value would be higher in the Naloxone condition than in the placebo condition.
analysis.p_value_desc: If the Winsorized value is excluded from analyses altogether, the P value is .012
analysis.method_desc: Cortisol was log transformed for the statistical test, and the reported mean difference was exponentiated back to the original units of nmol/L below.

outcome.title: Subjective Opiate Withdrawal Scale
outcome.description: Summed score of Subjective Opiate Withdrawal Scale (SOWS). Scale consists of 16 items answered on a 5 point numeric rating scale. Score range is 0 (lesser withdrawal symptoms) to 64 (greater withdrawal symptoms). Scores were assessed at 10 minutes after Naloxone, and at a separate visit, 10 minutes after Placebo, among participants who completed both study visits.
outcome.population: Measurement of Subjective Opiate Withdrawal Scale here reported 10 min post Naloxone or 10 minutes after Placebo, among all participants who received Naloxone (4mg / 0.1 ml), then after a washout period, received Placebo (saline, 0.1 ml), or Placebo, then after a washout period, received Naloxone, by participating in both study intervention visits.

group.title: Naloxone
group.description: Measurement of SOWS after Naloxone, among all participants who received Naloxone: 4 mg / 0.1 ml post eating at visit 1 and after a washout period, Placebo (saline): 0.1 ml post eating at visit 2, or were randomized to instead receive the same dosage of Placebo at visit 1 followed by a washout period and then Naloxone at visit 2.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Measurement of SOWS after Placebo, among all participants who received Naloxone: 4 mg / 0.1 ml post eating at visit 1 and after a washout period, Placebo (saline): 0.1 ml post eating at visit 2, or were randomized to instead receive the same dosage of Placebo at visit 1 followed by a washout period and then Naloxone at visit 2.

measure.title: Subjective Opiate Withdrawal Scale
measure.description: Summed score of Subjective Opiate Withdrawal Scale (SOWS). Scale consists of 16 items answered on a 5 point numeric rating scale. Score range is 0 (lesser withdrawal symptoms) to 64 (greater withdrawal symptoms). Scores were assessed at 10 minutes after Naloxone, and at a separate visit, 10 minutes after Placebo, among participants who completed both study visits.
measure.population: Measurement of Subjective Opiate Withdrawal Scale here reported 10 min post Naloxone or 10 minutes after Placebo, among all participants who received Naloxone (4mg / 0.1 ml), then after a washout period, received Placebo (saline, 0.1 ml), or Placebo, then after a washout period, received Naloxone, by participating in both study intervention visits.

outcome.title: Subjective Opiate Withdrawal Scale (Abbreviated)
outcome.description: Mean score on subset of 5 items (which used a 5 point numeric rating response scale) from the Subjective Opiate Withdrawal Scale (SOWS). This summed score can range from 0 (corresponding to lesser withdrawal symptoms) to 20 (corresponding to greater withdrawal symptoms).
outcome.population: Measurement of the abbreviated SOWS here reported 30 min post Naloxone or 30 min post Placebo, among all participants who received Naloxone (4mg / 0.1 ml), then after a washout period, received Placebo (saline, 0.1 ml), or Placebo, then after a washout period, received Naloxone, by participating in both study intervention visits.

group.title: Naloxone
group.description: Measurement of the abbreviated Subjective Opiate Withdrawal Scale here reported 30 min post Naloxone, among all participants who received Naloxone (4mg / 0.1 ml), then after a washout period, received Placebo (saline, 0.1 ml), or Placebo, then after a washout period, received Naloxone, by participating in both study intervention visits.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Measurement of the abbreviated Subjective Opiate Withdrawal Scale here reported 30 min post Placebo, among all participants who received Naloxone (4mg / 0.1 ml), then after a washout period, received Placebo (saline, 0.1 ml), or Placebo, then after a washout period, received Naloxone, by participating in both study intervention visits.

measure.title: Subjective Opiate Withdrawal Scale (Abbreviated)
measure.description: Mean score on subset of 5 items (which used a 5 point numeric rating response scale) from the Subjective Opiate Withdrawal Scale (SOWS). This summed score can range from 0 (corresponding to lesser withdrawal symptoms) to 20 (corresponding to greater withdrawal symptoms).
measure.population: Measurement of the abbreviated SOWS here reported 30 min post Naloxone or 30 min post Placebo, among all participants who received Naloxone (4mg / 0.1 ml), then after a washout period, received Placebo (saline, 0.1 ml), or Placebo, then after a washout period, received Naloxone, by participating in both study intervention visits.

outcome.title: Reward-Driven Eating Scale (RED)
outcome.description: Reward-Driven Eating Scale (RED) total score ranges from 0 (lower reward-driven eating) to 52 (higher reward-driven eating).
outcome.population: All eligible participants who were randomized to either order of intervention conditions.

group.title: Experimental: Naloxone, Then Placebo
group.description: Includes all participants randomized to receive Naloxone (4mg / 0.1 ml), then after a washout period, receive Placebo (saline, 0.1 ml), with reward-driven eating evaluated before the first study intervention.

group.title: Placebo, Then Naloxone
group.description: Includes all participants randomized to receive Placebo (saline, 0.1 ml), then after a washout period, receive Naloxone (4mg / 0.1 ml), with reward-driven eating evaluated before the first study intervention.

measure.title: Reward-Driven Eating Scale (RED)
measure.description: Reward-Driven Eating Scale (RED) total score ranges from 0 (lower reward-driven eating) to 52 (higher reward-driven eating).
measure.population: All eligible participants who were randomized to either order of intervention conditions.

outcome.title: Impulsivity (Delayed Discounting)
outcome.description: Impulsivity, measured by the Delayed Discounting cognitive task, based on a series of 30 computer-administered trials or questions. Indifference points (a measure of how much a person values a delayed reward) are determined for time delays of: 1 day, 7 days, 30 days, 180 days, and 365 days, and these are used to calculate an Area Under the Curve which ranges from 0 to 1 (lower numbers indicate higher impulsivity) as a metric of probability.
outcome.time_frame: Impulsivity was assessed before the study visit 1 intervention.
outcome.population: All eligible participants randomized to either order of the intervention.

group.title: Experimental: Naloxone, Then Placebo
group.description: Includes all participants randomized to receive Naloxone (4mg / 0.1 ml), then after a washout period, receive Placebo (saline, 0.1 ml), with reward-driven eating evaluated before the first study intervention.

measure.title: Impulsivity (Delayed Discounting)
measure.description: Impulsivity, measured by the Delayed Discounting cognitive task, based on a series of 30 computer-administered trials or questions. Indifference points (a measure of how much a person values a delayed reward) are determined for time delays of: 1 day, 7 days, 30 days, 180 days, and 365 days, and these are used to calculate an Area Under the Curve which ranges from 0 to 1 (lower numbers indicate higher impulsivity) as a metric of probability.
measure.population: All eligible participants randomized to either order of the intervention.

reported_events.time_frame: Two days (each study intervention visit was conducted over approximately 4 hours, with the 2 interventions administered on a total of 2 separate visit days).
reported_events.desc: The definition used did not differ from that of clinicaltrials.gov

group.title: Naloxone, Then Placebo
group.description: Visit 1 intervention condition: 4 mg / 0.1 ml Naloxone, followed by visit 2 condition: 0.1 ml Placebo (saline)

group.title: Placebo, Then Naloxone
group.description: Visit 1 intervention condition: 0.1 ml Placebo (saline), followed by visit 2 condition: 4 mg / 0.1 ml Naloxone

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
